column2: Unique identifier for each ER visit. Each patient may have multiple visit IDs if they return for different incidents.
Links each visit to a corresponding patient record from Hospital_Patients.csv.
Identifies which hospital location (e.g., MC_ER001_East or MC_ER002_West) handled the visit.
Timestamp recording when the patient arrived at the ER. Format varies to simulate manual entry inconsistencies.
Timestamp marking when registration began for the patient. Used to measure administrative efficiency.
Timestamp marking when registration ended for the patient.
Records when triage assessment began. Duration between these indicates triage workload.
Records when triage assessment ended. Duration between start and end indicates triage efficiency.
Timestamp for when the patient first saw a doctor,provider, physician.
Timestamp for when the patient left the ERâ€”either discharged, admitted, or transferred.

Categorical indicator of patient severity using a four-level system:1,2,3,4. Some inconsistencies are present due to staff entry errors and natural variations between shifts, reflecting real-world data challenges.
